page.title: 05Mixed Clubs in Trefriw
page.content: Trefriw has a public hall, run by a committee of villagers and Aberconwy Council,used by various organisations. 1. Pensioners Darby and Joan Club,run by a committee of village ladies. The club is bilingual, and meets fortnightly from early September until the Christmas party in December when it closes for the winter bad weather.It re-opens in March with a fund-raising effort, and ends in June with a summer excursion. Speakers are arranged, and afternoon tea is served at a very small charge. 2.A Youth Club meets once a week in the winter, with an age range of 7 to l5 yrs. The club is run by two paid adults. 3.Adventurers Club for young children is held weekly by the Rector of St. Mary' church. There is an attendance of twelve children on average.
